15.65.text:
- Welcome to another episode
of Absolute Match Fishing.

19.14.text:
My name's Matt Godfrey, and
today, you're joining me

21.39.text:
at the beautiful Packington
Somers Fishery near Coventry.

24.85.text: With me, I've got two superstar anglers.

27.82.text: First up is Mister Tommy Pickering.

30.26.text:
He's an ex-world champion
and he now manages

34.02.text:
However, he's fishing against
the mighty Andy Findlay,

39.89.text: and today, they'll both be giving away

41.98.text:
some secret tactics that will
help you catch more fish.

47.08.text: Well, here we are with the boys.

48.92.text: Nice to see you both, good morning.

52.32.text: - Yeah. Not bad, are you ready for it?

53.60.text:
- I'm ready for it always.
A bit nervous, yeah.

55.95.text:
- Well, it's time for
the all-important draw,

58.22.text: and somehow, I've managed to winkle

59.94.text:
a 50 pence piece out of
Tommy Pickering's pocket.

63.12.text:
But I'm sure he'll be asking
for it back after the flip.

65.58.text: - Not true, he'll be our best peg anyway,

67.51.text:
so I don't know why
we're bothering, really.

69.30.text: - Well, we've got to have the draw.

71.23.text: So, what are we having, boys?

73.90.text:
- Tails, it's always tails.
Me daddy always says tails.

82.53.text:
- Told ya, told ya.
- Always is.

83.93.text:
- Mister Pickering, you've
got the choice of pegs.

87.01.text:
- [Matt] Right, right.
- Because I know he wants it.

89.70.text:
- And that one's by far the
best peg, so he's gone for it.

92.88.text: Local expert, so I pinched his peg.

95.76.text: - Well, the bunt has started already,

97.61.text: and I'm gonna come along, find out a few

99.70.text:
of your little tricks of
the trade, and hopefully,

102.05.text: we'll catch plenty of fish on the way.

104.91.text:
- That'll do for me.
- Come on.

122.25.text: I'll make it just about time to start.

139.36.text:
- Well, I've learned more
about method feeder fishing

144.82.text:
He taught me how to put the
bait on the feeder correctly

148.09.text: and how to do it, you know, it's for me,

150.83.text:
like he's one of the top
commercial blokes in country.

155.16.text: I was struggling, but then he showed me

156.60.text: how to put it on the method,

157.93.text:
and when he showed me, I
just changed my outland style

160.85.text: a little bit to what he was doing.

162.84.text:
And it changed my way of
fishing, really, a lot.

165.53.text: So, I owe him a lot really.

166.92.text: And he knows that, 'cause I tell him so.

168.64.text: He's, I owe Andy a lot.

170.45.text:
- What can be said, he's
just about won everything

176.71.text:
Although I know the
venue better than Tommy,

179.30.text: beating him's still gonna be a really

185.27.text: - Sometimes, when you don't know water,

186.78.text:
you do things like, differently
to the local people.

190.14.text: Sometimes, you come down to a new venue,

193.00.text: just do your own thing and it's better

194.93.text:
'cause people around
the venue, all the time,

196.95.text:
they get a little bit
chilled to the set ways.

199.52.text: So, that's me only chance, really,

201.15.text: is the fact that I don't know the water,

202.98.text: and I'll come and do what I think is best.

205.28.text:
And sometimes, that's
the best thing to do.

207.19.text:
So, it's just, you know,
hopefully it works for me.

209.55.text: - I think I've drawn the lesser

210.90.text: of the two pegs, to be honest.

214.17.text: But as I say, I know the venue,

216.68.text: and I'm hoping line and feeding now

220.51.text:
is gonna come good for
me later in the match.

222.83.text: A lot of big carp in this place.

234.73.text:
- Well, I'm here with
Tommy, and he's just got off

237.14.text:
to a nice start with a run of
skimmers, haven't you, mate?

241.25.text: It's all skimmers at the moment,

242.33.text:
which I think it's probably
'cause I got mackerels

244.01.text: and method, to be honest with you.

245.82.text:
But one of them, a trick'll
do, rest of the day.

247.95.text: I'll be quite happy with that.

249.35.text:
I'm hoping for a few carp,
likely, but a nice start anyway.

253.60.text: Well, Andy's just took another carp now,

255.95.text:
but I reckon it's pretty
close at the minute.

258.76.text: What ya got? Five or six of them skimmers?

261.64.text: And he's got a couple of carp,

262.91.text: so, he'll be just in front of me.

264.52.text: But it's close. Early days, though.

267.42.text:
And I see that you're
fishing your method feeder.

270.86.text: - Yeah, it's a medium method feeder,

273.43.text:
'cause I think I'm gonna catch
some bigger carp later on.

275.89.text:
So, when I'm carp fishing,
I like the medium feeder

278.94.text:
with a 16 hook, and when I'm
fishing for F1s and that,

283.18.text:
I like it, just smaller
one with an 18 hook.

285.48.text: So, I balance everything with the size

287.09.text: of the hook that I'm using.

288.50.text:
- So, you're fishing a
bigger feeder that holds

290.34.text: a little bit more bait, and hopefully,

291.71.text:
you can build (indistinct)
and catch a few carp later.

294.12.text: - That's all I'm tryin' to do.

295.16.text: I'm just tryin' to work out at moment

296.63.text:
whether it's pellets or
whether it's ground bait,

298.27.text:
but the fish'll dictate
that later on in day.

301.54.text: And that's quite an important part

302.84.text: of method feeder fishing, isn't it?

304.21.text:
- Well, it's one of the
questions I get asked a lot.

305.96.text: Is it ground bit or is it pellet?

307.65.text: I don't know that. You can't answer that.

310.68.text: You got to try both on the day.

312.10.text:
Some days it's pellets,
some days it's ground bait.

314.25.text: And you never know which day.

315.59.text:
The only 100% thing is
if the anglers around you

320.07.text:
you'll have to put ground
bait on the feeder.

324.96.text:
And that's all there is.
Nothing more than that.

326.70.text: - And so far, pellets is best for you?

329.77.text: But I'll be tryin' ground bit, I'm sure.

331.30.text:
And I'll just, all I do, I
put a few pellets in first,

333.74.text: and put that on top, fill it with pellets,

337.20.text:
not overfill it, method
feeder on top, press,

340.92.text: release on the bottom, and it comes out

344.70.text:
I like to have the pellet
buried in the middle,

347.16.text:
whereas a lot of anglers
like it on the top.

349.11.text: But I believe when it's on the top,

350.80.text: it hits the water and it comes off.

353.61.text:
- And I'm trying to make
sure it never comes off,

356.19.text:
'cause I want the feeder to
go to the bottom in one piece,

359.02.text:
and I feel like if the
pellet's in the middle,

362.04.text:
it won't get knocked off when
it, the impact of the water.

366.29.text:
So, you've got a nice, tight
little ball about there,

368.47.text: and your pellet's right in the middle.

369.82.text: It'll break down. Fish'll come along.

371.75.text:
Shovel that up. Hopefully
your bait as well.

378.71.text: I wanna see you catch another one there.

380.05.text: - Alright. All you do, face your target.

386.92.text: Hit the clip, and it's eye to island.

389.58.text: Make sure it hits the bottom,

393.34.text:
- [Matt] You've got to leave
it in the exact spot it lands.

397.19.text:
And then all I do then, I just
try and keep the line tight.

400.39.text:
To make the line sink, all
I do, I just ease the line

403.66.text: between the reel and the first eye.

407.65.text: And if you got a fish at this position,

409.26.text: you'll feel it on your fingers.

410.55.text:
You'll feel it go like that,
and you just pick the rod up.

412.57.text:
- [Matt] A little bit of
hand-gliding then, Tommy.

415.55.text: Hopefully, and if you get him like that,

417.24.text: you know you're on for a good weight,

420.35.text: you're catching a lot of fish,

421.83.text:
and that the fish are
instantly coming to the feeder.

426.08.text: One trick, it hits the bottom.

427.87.text: If you get 'em very quickly, you know

430.33.text:
and you're on the right bait,
and it goes straight round.

436.29.text:
- [Matt] Now then, Mister
Findlay. How we gettin' on?

438.53.text:
- Well, we're, um, quite
a slow start, really.

443.28.text:
I started on the long-range
method to a floating island

446.33.text: over to me left, and as I expected,

449.53.text: I caught a couple of carp straight away,

452.92.text: but they were a bit on the small side.

456.15.text:
You could hardly fit one of
'em in your landing, there.

459.34.text:
We've had one about
three pound at the most.

461.85.text:
But in between them, we're
getting a few skimmers.

464.91.text: But I'm not really keeping up with Tommy.

466.91.text: He's definitely took the early lead.

470.18.text: So, I've had an off hour on that,

472.44.text: and I've been feeding me eight mil pellets

476.88.text:
and I've seen a few fish
move where they're landing.

483.59.text:
- [Matt] One just swilled
there, right on top.

485.42.text: - Yeah, they're a bit shallow for now.

487.05.text:
It's really warm today,
and the fish are all up.

491.32.text: later in the day, they will go down.

493.27.text: I'm gettin' a few liners on this, and um,

496.38.text: first, your comment of other carp,

498.26.text: about four pound, let's say it was,

500.44.text: but since then, not a lot's happened.

503.42.text:
- So, you've started your
match fishing a method feeder,

508.11.text:
and you're now fishing
a little bit closer,

512.47.text:
It's just the fact that I've
seen fish on these pellets,

515.10.text: I thought I'd have an early lot.

516.83.text:
Sure enough, I've had
the fish, but, you know,

519.52.text: I've gone on it too early to be right.

521.84.text: But, it could whip round any minute.

525.92.text:
But I'm looking soon, if
it doesn't improve soon,

530.76.text: I'll be back on me long-range method.

533.34.text:
Also, I'm feeding a pole line
with them six mil pellets

539.40.text: Again, to try that later in the match.

543.07.text:
- I can hear your reel
screeching a little bit then,

545.55.text: Andy, when that one took off.

547.29.text: - Yeah, it just flew around out the blue

549.38.text: like it often happens on this method.

552.12.text:
Yet we do (indistinct) a
bit before it got the bite,

557.31.text: and I can see fish on the surface.

559.45.text:
Lake's only three, four
deep where I'm fishing.

562.02.text: Well, it's just not going around.

567.55.text:
- Yeah. I think it's
partly because of that.

570.44.text: And it's just a bit too early in the day.

572.94.text: I'm trying to rush it on this line.

582.20.text:
I think there was just a
bit of slime on the hook,

584.73.text:
which normally indicates
a possibly foul hooked,

590.86.text:
- Before we do go back out,
let's take this opportunity

593.74.text:
to have a look at your
rig, if you don't mind.

596.92.text: - [Matt] Do you wanna talk me through it?

598.31.text: - [Andy] It's just a basic rig, really.

599.83.text: It's five-pound line from the reel,

602.68.text: down to a snap link swivel,

604.74.text: which is tied on with a polymer knot.

608.04.text: And onto that, before I clip me bum on,

610.66.text: I clip the hook length on first.

615.53.text: I say it's clipped on, but in fact,

619.02.text:
it's actually lassoed
on, and what that does,

623.36.text: Rather than just clip the loop on,

625.52.text: it's, you know, it's just one bit of line

627.70.text: going around the snap link swivel.

630.74.text: it's like double-line going around it,

632.50.text: so it makes it twice as strong in effect.

635.55.text:
- [Matt] You cannot get
much simpler than that.

637.46.text:
It looks like you've got quite
a long hook length there.

640.12.text: - It's just about a two-foot hook length.

644.67.text: And onto that, I've got a PR36.

649.80.text:
And it's actually lassoed
on the eight mil pellets.

654.05.text: I just lost that fish there.

656.79.text: It's gone a bit soft, as you can see.

660.01.text:
- And I believe, because
you feed 'em regular,

662.05.text: these hard pellets are going in,

663.89.text: and the fish are eating hard pellets.

666.28.text:
So for that reason, I'm
gonna take that off,

668.74.text:
and the way I do that, it
might look a bit fiddly, this,

672.37.text: but it isn't once you get used to it.

674.25.text:
I just get a quickstop needle
with quite a sharp point on it

678.64.text: and stick it in the pellet...

681.76.text: and just pull it open like that.

685.15.text: 'Cause it's a lasso, it'll just open up.

689.30.text:
Discard the pellet,
and pick a new one out.

696.19.text:
- [Matt] And then you've got
a nice, fresh, hard hook bait.

698.83.text:
- [Andy] That's right.
- [Matt] Same as the one--

701.60.text: You can see, that's a lot bigger,

702.91.text: because the longer you leave the hair,

705.60.text:
so it's very easy to
get the pellet in there.

708.19.text: It's not like messing about with bums.

710.23.text:
Some people find them
really fiddly, me included.

713.43.text:
And that just pulls down
onto the pellet, like so.

719.19.text: - And it's all ready to choke out.

722.78.text: - Yeah, try and not loose it this time.

742.46.text:
- Whoa! Obviously, a bit
of a nightmare, really.

744.67.text: I've just lost one on that side,

747.85.text: and then one come off in the net,

750.29.text: and then just choked out and got this.

751.85.text: So, there's a few ol' fish movin' in.

759.70.text: that I can actually see him again.

762.35.text:
They're actually chopping
around the island.

764.07.text:
So, when the feeder, when
the feeder's going in,

767.47.text:
I can see 'em out in the
feeder, which is brilliant news.

777.47.text: - We're well into the match now,

778.96.text:
and things are looking really
close between our two anglers.

782.37.text:
Tommy's got off to a great
start, catching some skimmers,

785.02.text: and two or three big carp on the method.

787.43.text:
Fin didn't get off so well,
but he's starting to catch

790.31.text:
some really big fish, fishing
with a bomb and pellet now.

793.58.text: So, I wouldn't wanna call who's winning.

795.79.text:
I'd say they both got
around the 40-pound mark.

798.93.text:
But they've got a change
of tactics in mind,

801.15.text: and it can all change yet.

820.33.text:
- I see you've had a slight
change of tactics there, Andy.

824.48.text:
- Yeah, well, I've been
feeding it from the off,

827.15.text: and it, you know, you've gotta try it.

829.68.text: It's no good feeding it the whole match

831.61.text: and then not even bothering to go on it.

833.71.text:
Not only that, the bomb and
pellet line went a bit slow,

836.45.text:
which it, you know, it can
always go around, anytime.

841.35.text:
If I have to feed this,
and we've got a nice wind

843.98.text:
blowing in now, so, I'm
sure there'll be a few fish

848.13.text:
on the pole, but as yet, I've
been at it five, ten minutes,

852.64.text:
and I've just had one
bite, which was a skimmer,

855.68.text:
come flyin' out the water
as they normally do.

858.68.text: But it come off at the same time.

862.87.text: some skimmers, and they just jump out.

864.52.text:
- Yeah, well this is, Packington
really is noted for that.

868.06.text:
I don't know if it's
'cause it's a shallow lake

870.91.text:
we're fishing, you know,
they can come straight up.

873.47.text: - [Matt] I'd love to know why they do.

875.11.text: I've seen it on loads of places.

876.41.text: I'm sure everyone else has, as well.

877.97.text:
- It's the occasional carp
does it, but these skimmers,

881.16.text:
on the whole, just a bit
of an indication there.

884.18.text:
There's fish there, but
if I don't catch within,

888.06.text: I don't know, another five or 10 minutes.

890.87.text: - [Matt] Or a bite, I think, was it.

892.72.text:
- Yeah, I'm gonna have to get
back on that bomb and pellet,

895.30.text:
'cause it was just starting,
well, it did start to happen,

899.94.text: but I went off our, we had a bite,

902.96.text:
in the later stages,
so to keep with Tommy,

907.35.text:
we really, you know,
we're just about level.

910.26.text: I've clawed back to being about level now.

917.81.text:
- You, uh, you've picked
a waggler up there,

920.95.text:
- Yeah, well, Andy's
catching a straight bomb.

922.90.text:
And I thought, he's
just in front of me now,

926.07.text:
so I've thought, I need to
have a look at those feed line.

928.97.text: And it's sometimes better out waggler,

934.60.text: It's nice. That wind's got up.

936.42.text: It's just spoiled it a bit now.

939.31.text: - [Matt] As soon as you've picked it--

940.95.text: - I know. About right, isn't it?

943.18.text: - It's kind of blowing across ya.

948.05.text:
- Generally, you sometimes
catch an odd fish

952.98.text:
by tricking your waggler
over it then, do ya?

955.16.text: - Well, I do it for two reasons, me.

957.57.text: I either chew me method over it,

959.36.text: but I ain't get a bite on it, that method.

961.47.text: So, we under-catch a not straight bomb.

963.69.text: Maybe they don't want the method.

965.17.text: They want just a pellet on its own,

967.30.text: so I'll set me waggler on it.

969.00.text: It's a great way of catching fish,

970.23.text: especially in this depth of water,

975.62.text:
But, I (indistinct) indication,
which is not a good sign.

981.14.text: If they don't want the method, you know,

983.09.text: then they want a single bait.

985.81.text:
- And that's a nice way of
presenting it, I suppose.

990.26.text:
Especially over, you
know, you lose feeding,

992.09.text: it gives you a different option, really.

997.95.text: and sometimes they pull your elastic out,

999.71.text:
or drag your rod in, but
there's not much nicer feeling

1002.50.text:
than when that fly goes
up and you're striking

1004.38.text: to a fish on a waggler, is there?

1005.91.text:
- It's best method. It will
waggler fishing, isn't it?

1007.71.text: I'll always catch loads of fish on it,

1010.80.text: especially in this type of venue.

1012.84.text: There's quite color here, as well, so,

1014.44.text:
it's not going on the
air, but like I said,

1019.13.text:
I've probably picked a bad
time to do it, to be fair.

1023.29.text: - Well, I've been and spent a bit of time

1025.33.text: with both anglers, and it's very close

1028.63.text:
It's sort of an hour of
the session remaining.

1030.88.text:
And probably the most interesting
thing that I've noticed

1034.00.text:
is that they've both set
two or three different kinds

1036.92.text:
of methods up, but they've
resorted back to the one

1039.92.text:
that was most productive
in the first hour.

1042.26.text:
Fin's caught some big fish
fairly early on on a bomb,

1045.47.text:
and after trying the pole,
he's back on the bomb now,

1048.07.text:
and he's just caught another
two or three really big carp.

1050.83.text:
Tommy started off catching
skimmers on a method.

1053.78.text: He's had a little try on a waggler.

1055.47.text: He's fired a few eight mils in open water,

1057.40.text: but it's not been the best for him today.

1059.77.text:
And now, he's back
tricking against the island

1063.11.text:
So, if anything, it proves
that you've really got to try

1065.53.text:
and find that best method
as quickly as possible.

1098.13.text: I think I'm in a bit of trouble now.

1100.29.text: I've just had one four-pounder me self,

1101.97.text: but I think, um, I think

1107.67.text: So I'll need a good last half-hour.

1113.88.text: There's a few ol' fish there now.

1132.07.text:
- It's coming up to the
finish of the match now,

1133.90.text: and I really don't know who's gonna win.

1136.13.text:
Obviously, the winner of
this round gets himself

1138.80.text:
an early draw in the final
in a few weeks' time.

1141.91.text:
So, I make it roundabout
time to finish 'em off now.

1153.51.text:
- [Tommy] 12 pound you've
done me by there, I reckon.

1157.46.text: - [Tommy] Well, you have, mate. Trust me.

1158.99.text: I don't mind being beat by you.

1171.28.text:
- [Matt] I wish my little
carp were that little.

1192.70.text: - Got about 15 pounds of skimmers, I saw.

1201.10.text:
That's a great amount
of skimmers, isn't it?

1217.07.text:
- [Matt] I'm gonna give you
there, Mister Pickering,

1226.61.text: - And that gives you a total, Tommy,

1235.28.text: - Cheers. Go on, mate. Cheers, mate.

1240.65.text:
- [Matt] It's struggling
with its lot, Tommy.

1243.63.text:
- Bring your little net out
first. That's the way to do it.

1247.47.text: Always bring little net out, just to--

1250.28.text:
- [Matt] You've got
some ghosters in there.

1252.76.text: - [Andy] Yeah, all colors. Look at that.

1255.57.text:
- [Tommy] Well done,
mate. That's the winner.

1262.45.text:
- [Tommy] That makes a
colorful bag, doesn't it?

1265.28.text:
- [Tommy] I'm not gonna be
strong enough to hold this.

1267.11.text: - [Matt] I'm gonna have to lift it up.

1271.83.text: There's more than you think there.

1284.65.text: Yet not as manny skimmers as you, Tommy.

1286.55.text:
- I know, but he's got enough.
He don't need many, does he?

1293.30.text:
- Now remember, mate,
you're a Yorkshire man.

1294.97.text:
So, when you read this
out, think Yorkshire.

1297.64.text: That's what you've got to do.

1300.04.text: Nice. Think Yorkshire all time, mate.

1316.29.text: Not as many skimmers as, uh--

1317.87.text: - No, that's where I failed at.

1319.68.text:
- [Tommy] He's not a
skimmer angler, is he, Andy?

1321.61.text:
- So that gives Fin a
total weight of 56 pounds,

1324.51.text:
meaning Tommy, you're
the champion of the day.

1328.51.text:
- Well, I'm not disappointed
coming second to you,

1330.91.text: whether you fished here or not.

1332.65.text:
- [Tommy] Cheers, mate.
It's always a pleasure.

1336.61.text: too much respect for the man,

1339.44.text:
I've learned loads from
him over the years,

1341.23.text: and uh, it's just a pleasure.

1342.71.text: It's good match between us, really.

1346.38.text: Another fantastic day on the bank

1347.89.text:
with two of the best
anglers in the country.

1350.11.text: Tommy Pickering's won on the day

1353.91.text:
While Andy Findlay still had
a very respectable 56 pounds.

1359.27.text: I'm sure these two have, as well.

1360.87.text:
We'll catch you next time
on Absolute Match Fishing.
